page.title: 08Cramlington:Recreation
page.content:
Concordia Leisure Centre was built in 1977 at a cost of two and a half million pounds, paid for by Blyth Valley Council. It provides opportunities for many activities including various sports, a play group, a sauna and solarium and a leisure pool. It has catering facilities and many people use these to hold events such as parties and wedding receptions. The results of a questionnaire show that: a)Most people in the area use the centre at least once a week. b)The facilities are good, but rather expensive, particularly for families. Mr.Tuthill, the manager, would like to see a theatre or cinema added at a future date.
Crawhall F.S.
